output_list.reason: The distributeBTR function allows the owner to distribute BTCR tokens to a list of addresses in a way that can lead to an integer overflow, causing a large amount of tokens to be frozen in user accounts. This can be exploited to devalue the token.
The transfer function does not prevent overflow during addition in the balanceOf recipient, allowing users to gain unintended funds.
The transferFrom function does not prevent overflow during addition in the balanceOf recipient, allowing users to gain unintended funds.
The approve function does not prevent overflow during addition in the allowed mapping, allowing users to gain unintended allowances.
The approve function does not check if the spender is a smart contract, allowing it to be spammed by smart contracts that can call approve and transferFrom in a way that steals funds.
